Plays > A Tragic Love Triangle

– Click image to view.

A Tragic Love Triangle

(艶容女舞衣) (Hadesugata onna maiginu)

Written By: Takemoto Saburobei (竹本三郎兵衛) , Toyotake Ōritsu (豊竹応律) , Yatami Heishichi (八民平七) , Ki Kaion (紀海音)

First Staged: 1772

Reference: Keene, Donald, Bunraku: The Art of the Japanese Puppet Theatre (Tokyo: Kodansha International, 1973); Hironaga, Shūzaburō, The Bunraku Handbook (Tokyo: Maison des Arts, 1976); Kokuritsu Gekijō jōen shiryōshū, edited by Kokuritsu Gekijō Geinō Chōsashitsu, vol. 218, Bunraku September 1983, January 1987 Performance Programs

Kashira:

Sadanoshin (定之進)

Shūto (sewa) (舅（世話）)

Baba (婆)

Decchi (丁稚)

Koyaku (子役)

Fukehayaku (老端役)

Genta (源太)

Musume (娘)

Shūto (舅)

Baba (sewa) (婆（世話）)

Nemuri no musume (ねむりの娘)

Onna koyaku (女子役)

Jiji (sewa) (爺（世話）)

Takeuji (武氏)

Tsurifune (釣船)

Performances:

February 1970: A Tragic Love Triangle

January 1972: A Tragic Love Triangle

November 1972: A Tragic Love Triangle

February 1973 Tour: A Tragic Love Triangle

July 1974: A Tragic Love Triangle

May 1975: A Tragic Love Triangle

February 1977: A Tragic Love Triangle

July 1979: A Tragic Love Triangle

March 1982: A Tragic Love Triangle

September 1983: A Tragic Love Triangle

October 1983: A Tragic Love Triangle

January 1987: A Tragic Love Triangle

September 1987: A Tragic Love Triangle

April 1991: A Tragic Love Triangle

May 1992: A Tragic Love Triangle

Scenes:

The Woods of the Tenjin Shrine (天神森)

Fishing for Wives (釣女)

The Temmaya Tea House (天満屋)

Characters:

Sankatsu (美濃屋三勝)

Hanshichi's mother (半七の母)

Chota (丁稚長太)

Hambei's wife (半兵衛女房)

Otsu (娘お通)

Hambei (舅半兵衛)

Leader of the five-man group (五人組の頭)

Sogan (親宗岸)

Osono (嫁お園)

Hanshichi (茜屋半七)

Members of the five-man group (五人組)
